p: Galenia pubescens (Eckl. & Zeyh.) is a prostrate perennial herb indigenous to South Africa [ 23]. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family (Ice plants) and is a C 4 plant that has adapted to grow in the deserts of southern Africa [ 24]. It is commonly known as ‘blanket weed’, ‘carpet weed’ or ‘green galenia’ and is considered a serious environmental weed in many countries including Australia, where it invades dry coastal vegetation, lowland grassland and grassy woodland, dry sclerophyll forest and woodland, and rocky outcrop vegetation [ 25].
